Economic boom: If all world debt was erased, it would lead to an economic boom as people would have more money to invest in businesses and the economy would grow.
Increased consumer spending: People would have more disposable income and would be more likely to spend money on goods and services, leading to an increase in consumer spending.

Improved infrastructure: With more money available, governments would be able to invest in infrastructure projects such as roads, bridges, and public transportation systems, leading to improved connectivity and efficiency.
Reduced poverty: With the elimination of debt, more people would have access to financial resources and would be able to escape poverty.
Changes in financial systems: The erasure of debt could lead to changes in financial systems, as lenders and borrowers would need to adapt to a world without debt.
